description: List of tables in the CMDB in a base system with its name, label, and a description of the type of information that is stored in the table.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_appl_now_app
tables.label: ServiceNow Application
tables.description:
CIs that Event Management generates for various components such as Impact calculator, which is used to bind alerts that are later shown in maps. Used internally by self-health when monitoring internal health checks for key components
 such as connector instance status and MID Server status.  Parent class for all ServiceNow applications.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_application_cluster

tables.name: cmdb_ci_application_server_resource

tables.description:
Parent class for application servers such as Coldfusion application

tables.label: Azure datacener
tables.description: Logical representation of a Microsoft Azure datacenter.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_chassis_server

tables.label: Cloud IP Address
tables.description: Web server which runs on a cloud computing platform.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_cluster
tables.label: Cluster
tables.description: Logical group of computing resources bound together by software to function as one logical computing resource.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_cluster_node
tables.label: Cluster Node
tables.description:
Single computing resource which is logically/operationally bound into a
 cluster.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_cluster_resource
tables.label: Cluster Resource
tables.description:
System object that is a set or grouping of cluster resources that are used to
 manage events that occur in a clustered environment.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_cluster_vip
tables.label: Cluster Virtual IP
tables.description: Cluster VIP information.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_cmp_price_product_base
tables.label: Cloud Product Price Base
tables.description:
Used to calculate the approximate monthly cost of running a stack built on
 Virtual Servers in cloud environment: Cloud Price Base: Common price base to store pricing info of all the
 resources of all the supported clouds.  Cloud Price Product Base: Base table to store the common attributes of all
 the pricing resources.  VM Instance Price: Specific table that extends the Cloud Price Product base to store the VM specific product info of all the supported clouds.  Parent class for cloud product prices such as VM instance price.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_cmp_resource
tables.label: Cloud Resource
tables.description: Generic cloud resources.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_comm
tables.label: Communication Device
tables.description:
Communication devices information. A choice list containing devices such as
 cellphone, phone, conference phone, and Wi-Fi.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_computer_room
tables.label: Computer Room
tables.description: Logical representation of a computer room.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_config_automation_server
tables.label: Management Server
tables.description:
Dev Ops tools such as Chef and Puppet, that are used to manage server
 configurations.  Parent class for application management servers.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_config_file
tables.label: Configuration file
tables.description:
Configuration files which establish the parameters and initial settings for
 some computer programs.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_crac
tables.label: Computer Room AC
tables.description: Air conditioning units used to cool data centers.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_csu_dsu_network
tables.label: CSU/DSU
tables.description:
Digital-interface device used to connect networking equipment to a digital
 circuit.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_database
tables.label: Database
tables.description:
Organized collection of data such as the set of files where data is stored, the
 reason for a database, and the metadata about the data.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_datacenter
tables.label: Data Center
tables.description:
Facility used to house computer systems and associated components, such as
 telecommunications and storage systems. It generally includes redundant or backup
 power supplies, redundant data communications connections, environmental controls
 (such as air conditioning and fire suppression), and various security
 devices.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_datapower_server
tables.label: Data Power Hosting Server
tables.description: Server running IBM DataPower Gateway software.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_datastore
tables.label: Datastore
tables.description:
Datastores are like file systems, abstracting the physical storage and providing
 a model for storing files. The child class represents the VMware specific
 Datastore.  Parent class for VMWare datastore object types such as vCenter Datastores.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_db_catalog
tables.label: Database Catalog
tables.description:
Metadata which defines database objects such as base tables, views (virtual
 tables), synonyms, value ranges, indexes, users, and user groups, for a specific

Cloud Foundry provides a highly efficient, modern model for cloud native

Physical device which makes a persistent human-readable representation of
 graphics or text on paper or similar physical media.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_qtree

tables.name: cmdb_ci_qualifier
tables.label: Qualifier
tables.description:
Relation qualifier CIs which contain important information about CI
 relationships.  In a relation qualifier, you can annotate arbitrary unique information about the
 relationship between two CIs. You can define multiple qualifiers for a single
 relationship, resulting in a qualifier chain. However, there can be only a single
 qualifier chain for a specific relationship type between two CIs.  Parent class for the various relation qualifier types such as EntryPoint Markers
 and Boundary Connections.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_rack

tables.description:
Datacenter racks containing details such as rack units, rack units in use, and
 power consumption.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_resource_group

tables.description:
Resource pool is a logical abstraction for flexible management of
 resources.

 dynamic.

Base table for the iSCSI Export [cmdb_ci_iscsi_export] and the Fibre Channel
 Export [cmdb_ci_fc_export] tables.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_san_fabric
tables.label: SAN Fabric
tables.description:
Hardware that connects workstations and servers to storage devices in a SAN.
 Referred to as a "fabric."

tables.name: cmdb_ci_san_zone
tables.label: SAN Zone
tables.description: Subset of SAN storage that certain users are restricted to.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_san_zone_alias
tables.label: SAN Zone Alias
tables.description: Collection of SAN zone members.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_san_zone_alias_member
tables.label: SAN Zone Alias Member
tables.description: M2m relationship between SAN zone aliases and SAN zone members.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_san_zone_member
tables.label: SAN Zone Member
tables.description: Ports and devices in a SAN zone.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_san_zone_set
tables.label: SAN Zone Set
tables.description: Collection of SAN zones.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_scanner
tables.label: Scanner
tables.description: Hardware used to create digital imagine of paper documents.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_server
tables.label: Server
tables.description: Base class for all types of servers.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_server_snapshot
tables.label: Server Snapshot
tables.description:
Server snapshot, which is the state of a system at a particular point in
 time.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_service
tables.label: Service
tables.description: IT Service that directly supports a Business Process (ITIL).

tables.name: cmdb_ci_service_auto
tables.label: Service Instance
tables.description: Services that can be monitored by the system, which in the base system, includes only application services. If Service Mapping is activated, there can also be records for dynamic CI groups. If Event Management is activated, there can be records for alert groups.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_service_business
tables.label: Business Service
tables.description:
Business services are published to business users and typically underpin one or
 more business capabilities. Business services are often orderable by business
 users.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_service_discovered
tables.label: Mapped Application Service
tables.description:
Application services, created by the Manual service population method. For each
 application service, there is a container CI record that models the application
 service.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_service_technical
tables.label: Technology Management Service (formerly Technical Service)
tables.description:
Technology management services are published to service owners and typically underpin one or more business services. A technology management service may have an operational view made up of one or more technical
 management offerings.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_solaris_instance
tables.label: Solaris Virtual Machine Instance
tables.description: Virtual machine instance running Solaris software.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_solaris_server
tables.label: Solaris Server
tables.description: Physical server running Solaris software.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_spkg
tables.label: Software
tables.description:
Software package information containing details such as version, install count,
 license count, package name, and key (when SAM enabled).

tables.name: cmdb_ci_storage_controller
tables.label: Storage Controller
tables.description: Logical device that controls a storage volume or Fibre Channel port.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_storage_device
tables.label: Storage Device
tables.description: Base table for block storage devices such as DAS, SAN, and NAS.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_storage_disk
tables.label: Storage Disk
tables.description: Disk installed in a storage server.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_storage_export
tables.label: Storage Export
tables.description: Base table for the SAN Export [cmdb_ci_san_export] table.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_storage_fileshare
tables.label: Storage File Share
tables.description: NAS file system on a storage server (an exported file system).

tables.name: cmdb_ci_storage_hba
tables.label: Storage HBA
tables.description:
Host bust adapter for Fibre Channel. The physical device that provides Fibre
 Channel ports.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_storage_pool
tables.label: Storage Pool
tables.description: Logical collection of storage.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_storage_pool_member
tables.label: Storage Pool Member
tables.description: Logical volume in a storage pool.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_storage_switch
tables.label: Storage Switch
tables.description: Fibre Channel switch.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_storage_volume
tables.label: Storage Volume
tables.description: Volume on a storage server.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_storage_vol_snapshot
tables.label: Storage Volume Snapshot
tables.description: Server snapshot is the state of a system at a particular point in time.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_subnet
tables.label: Cloud Mgmt Subnet
tables.description: Part of a larger network.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_sun_dir_proxy_server
tables.label: Sun Directory Proxy Server
tables.description: Server running Sun ONE Directory Proxy Server software.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_sun_ldap_dir_server
tables.label: Sun LDAP Server
tables.description: Server running Sun ONE Directory Server (LDAP) software.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_surge_power_eq
tables.label: Surger Protection Equipment
tables.description: Power equipment used to prevent power surges.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_tape_server
tables.label: Server Tape Unit
tables.description: Hardware for using magnetic tape storage.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_tomcat_connector
tables.label: Tomcat Connector
tables.description:
Software which provides web server plugins to connect web servers with Tomcat
 and other backends.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_tower_eq
tables.label: Tower Equipment
tables.description:
Parent class for facility towers and tower equipment such as lights and
 beacons.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_translation_rule
tables.label: NAT
tables.description: Rules to allow router to remap one network address to another.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_transport_hardware
tables.label: Transport Hardware
tables.description:
Telecommunication hardware used for digital communication and related hardware
 such as telecommunication racks, servers to connect port to LAN, relays, channel
 banks, and network circuit switch.  Parent class for telecom transport hardware such as multiplexers and fiber optic
 equipment.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_ucs_blade
tables.label: Cisco UCS Blade
tables.description: Physical Cisco UCS Blade server hardware.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_ucs_chassis
tables.label: Cisco UCS Chassis
tables.description:
Physical Cisco UCS chassis hardware used to hold Cisco UCS Blade server
 hardware.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_ucs_equipment
tables.label: Cisco UCS Equipment
tables.description: Cisco Unified Computing System (UCS) products.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_unix_cluster
tables.label: UNIX Cluster
tables.description:
Set of computers clustered together to present a single Unix server
 resource.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_unix_daemon
tables.label: UNIX Daemon
tables.description:
Long running Unix background process used to answer requests for
 services.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_unix_server
tables.label: UNIX Server
tables.description: Server running Unix software.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_ups
tables.label: UPS
tables.description:
Uninterrupted Power Supply devices, where devices are traditional UPS
 devices.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_ups_alarm
tables.label: UPS Alarm
tables.description: Uninterrupted Power Supply alarm.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_ups_bypass
tables.label: UPS Bypass
tables.description: Uninterrupted Power Supply bypass.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_ups_input
tables.label: UPS Input
tables.description: Electrical input to an Uninterrupted Power Supply device.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_ups_output
tables.label: UPS Output
tables.description: Electrical output from an Uninterrupted Power Supply device.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_ups_power_eq
tables.label: Uninterruptible Power Supply
tables.description:
Uninterrupted Power Supply devices, where devices are any non-traditional UPS
 devices that manage electrical power.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vcenter
tables.label: VMware vCenter Instance
tables.description: Installed instance of VMware VCenter software.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vcenter_cluster
tables.label: VMware vCenter Cluster
tables.description:
Set of servers that work together while running VMware VCenter
 software.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vcenter_cluster_drs_rule
tables.label: VMWare vCenter Cluster DRS Rule
tables.description:
vCenter specific table which stores Distributed Resource Scheduler (DRS) basic
 rule information. Stores the affinity rule specifying that the members of a
 selected virtual machine DRS group can or must run on the members of a specific
 host DRS group.  Populated by the [vCenter API ClusterRuleInfo(vim.cluster.RuleInfo)](https://code.vmware.com/apis/196/vsphere#/doc/vim.cluster.RuleInfo.html) .

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vcenter_datacenter
tables.label: VMware vCenter Datacenter
tables.description: VMware VCenter data center objects.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vcenter_datastore
tables.label: VMware vCenter Datastore
tables.description:
VMware VCenter datastore objects containing details such as capacity,
 freespace, filesystem, and type.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vcenter_datastore_disk
tables.label: Datastore Disk
tables.description: Individual VMware VCenter datastore disk.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vcenter_folder
tables.label: VMware vCenter Folder
tables.description:
VCenter folders, which can be used to group objects of the same type for easier
 management.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vcenter_network
tables.label: VMware vCenter Network
tables.description: VMWare vCenter virtual network.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vcenter_object
tables.label: VMware vCenter Object
tables.description: Base class for most VMware VCenter objects.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vcenter_server_obj
tables.label: VMware vCenter Server Object
tables.description: VMware hypervisor.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_veritas_disk
tables.label: Veritas Disk
tables.description: Physical disk that is controlled by Veritas Volume Manager.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_veritas_disk_group
tables.label: Veritas Disk Group
tables.description: Collection of disks in Veritas Volume Manager.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_veritas_plex
tables.label: Veritas Plex
tables.description: Logical partition in Veritas Volume Manager.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_veritas_subdisk
tables.label: Veritas Subdisk
tables.description: Partition of a Veritas_disk.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_veritas_volume
tables.label: Veritas Volume
tables.description: Aggregation of plexes.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_virtualization_server
tables.label: Virtualization Server
tables.description: Base table used by the ESX Server [cmdb_ci_esx_server] table.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_virtual_desktop
tables.label: Virtual Desktop
tables.description:
User's desktop environment (such as icons, wallpaper, windows, folders,
 toolbars, and widgets) is stored remotely on a server.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_virtual_pvt_gateway
tables.label: Virtual Private Gateway
tables.description: Two VPN endpoints for automatic failover.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vm
tables.label: Virtual Machine HyperVisor
tables.description: Hypevisor software.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vm_instance
tables.label: Virtual Machine Instance
tables.description: Generic virtual machines information.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vm_object
tables.label: Virtual Machine Object
tables.description:
Base class for all VM objects. Parent for all objects such as Hyper-V object
 and KVM object.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vm_parallels
tables.label: Parallels
tables.description: Instance of Parallels software.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vm_template
tables.label: Virtual Machine Template
tables.description: Template, which is a main copy of a virtual machine that can be used to create many clones. Base table for all VM templates.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vm_user_credentials
tables.label: VM User Credentials
tables.description:
Credentials, which are used to authenticate access rights and
 permissions.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vm_vmware
tables.label: VMware
tables.description: Note: No longer used. VMWare specialization of the Virtual Machine table.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vm_zones
tables.label: Zones
tables.description:
Partitioned virtual OS environment working in a Solaris operating system
 space.

tables.name:
cmdb_ci_voice_hardware  (Installed with the com.snc.cmdb.telecom.category
 plugin)
tables.label: Voice System Hardware
tables.description:
Telecommunication systems that represent telephone systems, telephone exchanges,
 and voice mail.  Parent class for telecom voice system hardware such as voicemail and private
 branch exchanges.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_volume_template
tables.label: Volume Template
tables.description:
Set of rules that specify one or more capabilities of a storage volume (storage
 selection and layout rules).

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vmware_instance
tables.label: VMware Virtual Machine Instance
tables.description: VMware VM instance on VMware hypervisor.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vmware_template
tables.label: VMware Virtual Machine Template
tables.description: Main copy of a VMware virtual machine that can be used to create many clones.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vpc
tables.label: Virtual Private Cloud
tables.description:
On-demand configurable pool of shared computing resources allocated within a
 public cloud environment.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vpn
tables.label: Virtual Private Network
tables.description: Private network configured to run across a public network.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vpn_connection
tables.label: VPN Connection
tables.description: Secure connection to another network over the Internet.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_vserver_peer
tables.label: Vserver Peer
tables.description:
Extends the Virtual Machine Object [cmdb_ci_vm_object] table. Peer relationship
 between the Vservers (NetApp).

tables.name: cmdb_ci_wap_network
tables.label: Wireless Access Point
tables.description:
Networking hardware device that allows a Wi-Fi compliant device to connect to a
 wired network.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_web_application
tables.label: Web Application
tables.description:
Client–server software application in which the client (or user interface) runs
 in a web browser.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_web_domino
tables.label: Lotus Domino HTTP Server
tables.description: Server running IBM Notes software (formerly Lotus Notes/IBM Domino).

tables.name: cmdb_ci_web_server
tables.label: Web Server
tables.description:
Computer system that processes requests via HTTP from the World Wide
 Web.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_web_service
tables.label: Web Service
tables.description:
Service offered by an electronic device to another electronic device,
 communicating with each other via the World Wide Web.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_web_site
tables.label: Web Site
tables.description: A collection of related web pages.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_websphere_cell
tables.label: Websphere Cell
tables.description:
A logical grouping of IBM Websphere nodes (each of which runs one or more
 application servers) that are centrally managed.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_win_cluster
tables.label: Windows Cluster
tables.description: A single (virtual) server composed of one or more physical Windows Servers.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_win_cluster_node
tables.label: Windows Cluster Node
tables.description: A physical member of the Windows Cluster application.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_win_cluster_resource
tables.label: Windows Cluster Resource
tables.description:
A logical or physical entity managed by the Windows Cluster
 application.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_win_domain_controller
tables.label: Windows Domain Controller
tables.description:
A server that responds to security authentication requests within a Windows
 Server domain.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_win_server
tables.label: Windows Server
tables.description: A server running Microsoft Windows Server operating system.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_windows_service
tables.label: Windows Service
tables.description: A Windows computer program that operates in the background.

tables.name: cmdb_ci_zone
tables.label: Data Center Zone
tables.description: A specified portion of a data center facility.
